caption: My family took me here for dinner on my 75th. birthday. Courteous and patient staff. The food was delicious and plentiful, the whole family commented on the quality of the dishes.
Excellent food and top notch service.  Would highly recommend this neighborhood gem.

Great food. Kitchen was a bit busy since it was Valentine's day and because we had a late reservation, but the service was fantastic and offered small dishes to hold us over while our food was coming out.
Delicious fusion menu in a warm romantic atmosphere; service is topnotch as well. They do seafood particularly well

Corduroy was amazing! My partner and I both got the chef's tasting menu and we were incredibly pleased with both the food and the service. Our waiter answered our questions, offered good recommendations, and was very attentive.  The tasting menu was very filling and worth the price point. Our courses were the cold chili soup, tuna tartare, soft-shelled​ crab, pork loin and squash, lamb and spinach, and dessert (chocolate​ cake and pistachio bread pudding). All of the dishes were delicious, but the highlights were the pork, lamb, and pistachio bread pudding.  The restaurant​ was very nice; we were seated on the second floor and it was nice, quiet, and relatively​ private.  Another thing to note is that our reservation was for 7:30 (seated on time) and we left the restaurant slightly after 10, so plan for the tasting menu to take between 2.5 and 3 hours.
Quiet, excellent service and great food..not handicap accessible
Great food, slow service.  Not sure if they can handle a small group.  Food made up for it.

Delightful. I think a must try is the chef's surprised five-course tasting menu, it's worth it! The courses are some sort of derivatives from the actual menu, but in a petite portion. The presentation of each dish is fancy and appetizing. I don't wanna describe too much detailed to ruin the surprises, but complimentary photos are shown with this review for you to get an idea. A little tip: there is an additional bar menu upstairs if you would like a more casual dining experience. They have a three-course tasting menu as well, which is my another recommendation, phenomenal value. You can choose from the bar menu how you want to make up your own three courses.
I was taken here as a surprise birthday dinner. The staff was excellent and the food was great.
Amazing food and service. Highly recommend!
Intimate setting with excellent service.  Able to host business meals for several or dinner for two.

We had a planned business luncheon at Corduroy last week and it was by far the BEST lunch ever! They opened just for our group and everyone was perfect! The food, the service, the planning...all great! Don't miss this place if you are in DC :)
Fine Dining
Great food and service, excellent wine selection, quiet enough for a civilized conversation.

Awesome food!! Restaurant was dead, didn't bother me, but I was with someone who wanted to be seen. Also, when a diner at my table ordered the souffle I could tell that the waiter and kitchen staff were disappointed. It was very clear to that they wanted to close shop early and get us out of there, turning off lights ect. Slightly disappointed since we were there to spend money, expensive wine and multiple courses.
The whitefish salad is to die for!

An amazing tasting menu, beautiful restaurant, service impeccable, and the food extraordinary superb taste, gorgeous plates, definitely recommend for a fine dining place, some of the pictures here doesn’t make justice for the amazing dishes

So here is the deal. I got a dinner for 2 valued at $120 thru Verizon up program. After making the reservation  I took my wife and we went to the restaurant. The restaurant is very nice and quiet with low lighting, it has a modern look to it. The lady who greeted us was super nice and gave us our Verizon up menus. Then came the server. When she saw we had Verizon up menus she looked not so happy. She never introduced herself. She took our order. I ordered green salad that was great. Then Flat iron steak with mushrooms for main course ( she never asked what sides I wanted when the plate can it had potatoes and green beans on it). I did not want to make a scene but anyway the food was excellent. Kudos to the Chef. Then came dessert it was Pistachio bread pudding, which was delicious. Other then the server being standoffish and  not coming to check on us the restaurant was beautiful and the food was great.
What can I say.... everything was great! Food and service was top quality. Ahi tuna and scallops cooked perfectly.
Nice quiet pleasant atmosphere. Interesting menu and excellent food. Great service. Large drinks menu. Reasonable prices.

I have wanted to come here for years. It completely lived up to expectations. Delicious, creative food locally sourced. Great wine, impeccable service. Quiet and elegant. Come with someone who will appreciate it, as I did.
Amazing Wine List! The food was excellent as well and I would surely come back! A tip of the hat goes to the wonderful staff who are all very knowledgeable and accommodating.
Delicious! Great room for a small private event.

The food itself was quite good, and the tuna tartar in particular was delicious. The staff was nice as well but the overall service was incredibly slow. Appetizers were out quickly but nearly an hour passed before entrees made it out, and it was quite staggered even amongst our own table. Furthermore, we had ordered off a set menu at the start of the meal, but when dessert was being served, we were informed that they were out of one option that several people had ordered. Seems odd to include something on a limited set menu (work event) when you dont have enough in stock.  Finally, on a sweltering day in DC, the AC wasn't working well and the dining area was an oven for the duration of the meal.
Great place, fabulous food with excellent staff.
Never disappoints and always delicious

Second time we've been and second time the front of the house was enough to prevent us from returning. Last time, pushy up-selling (on my birthday!), this time it felt like they didn't give a Damn we were there. Too bad because chef-owner Tom Powers was in the kitchen and he can cook. We'll stick with Tom's Baby Wale next door: much better service, despite being more casual.

After many good visits a disastrous meal:  we ordered fettuccine and received after a very, very  long delay bland and dry ravioli without explanation.  Could not understand the discourtesy.   Used to think C. was one of the best in Washington, but don't expect to return any time soon.

This restaurant is a jewel! The ambience is hip and elegant, and tables are spaced far enough apart to talk at dinner. The food was creative and tasty, menu selection was so varied it was hard to choose. The service was attentive and they truly cared about our experience. 5 stars all the way!! Karen C.
Good food
wonderful food
Great service

Wonderful location. Great atmosphere and friendly and accommodating staff. Had the pleasure of having Michael as our server and he delivered above and beyond. Between food and wine recommendations, Michael made sure all our needs were met. The food was amazing as well as the cocktails.
Great food and attentive wait staff!

The food is good, but with an extremely limited selection. Very meat-centric; vegetarian options are not on the menu. Another patron needed to inquire and have a vegetarian meal made special. I had the lobster carpaccio starter and sea bass main course. The prices are quite expensive and while the food is decent I do not believe it justifies the price. The atmosphere is a bit stuffy given the quality of the food. Waiters constantly removing things (like the bread (?!), glasses and plates). Anyways, I was disappointed after having heard positive things. There are much better options in the area. For 7 people and no alcohol the bill was well over $500 with tip. The restaurant is trying for a fine dining experience but just misses the mark IMHO. It seems they market themselves as a place to be used for impressing a date: expensive, small plates, and 'atmosphere.' Lastly, for beer afficianados, they have a grand total of 6 beers, none of which are of any consequence. Extensive wine list, however. One bottle was listed at $1400.
(Translated by Google) Amazing tatsing menu.  (Original) Amazing tatsing menu.

We ate here on Christmas day for an early dinner. Service and staff were polite and professional. Cocktails were very good, the preset menu had a nice selection of choices to choose from. The "blintz" was more like a springroll but was tasty. The elk/antelope was cooked as I ordered, medium rare, and the sides were complementary to the meat as a flavor combination. Desserts were good and wine list quality was very good, including by the glass. Usually by the glass selections are poor quality but not so here. Will return for sure.
Excellent food.. a little slow but good
Decent steak.

Very nice place. It's a bit hard to find with a little construction nearby as the sign is quite small. The steps to the building are building are beautiful but a bit steep. The food was excellent and the wait staff was very attentive. The restaurant is pretty quiet and good for conversation. I was a bit frustrated by how hard our waiter pushed additional wine after we ordered a bottle. There was one small error on our desert order that was a quick fix. I'd recommend it for a nice business dinner or a high class date night.

Very good tasting menu. We got to try the lobster bisque with corn, tuna carpaccio with tomato, pork loin, bison steak, bread pudding and chocolate special. The bisque had a nice sherry flavor and the corn kernels were a good addition. The deserts were great.
Truly amazing wine list, some incredible bottles.
Provided a wonderful experience for our 50th anniversary celebration with family. Perfect.
The staff is very knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful, and the food was absolutely fantastic!
Elexcent food and service
Good food crappy service
Great service, very friendly with wonderful food
Great restaurant with wonderful service  I had red snapper bisque and sea bass as main course. Both were excellent. Extensive wine list with many wines priced very fairly. I will return

Went to Corduroy to celebrate our five year anniversary. We loved the location, the ambiance, the service, the atmosphere. The hostess took our jackets and seated us, and we immediately liked the restaurant.  Service was a bit slow to begin; not sure why, since there were only a few tables seated, but we weren't in a hurry and didn't mind. If anything it reminded us of eating in Europe a bit.  The drinks were good--nothing particularly amazing, but nothing disappointing, either. I think Del Campo has better cocktails, for instance, but I enjoyed my drinks well enough. I had a Blood Orange 75 (tasty) and a St. Croix Mule (good).  For our dinners we decided to try the Chef's Tasting Menu for $70 each. This turned out to be a little ambitious--you get quite a bit of food, particularly if you start off with the bread and better. (My recommendation would be to skip the bread, if you plan on doing the tasting menu.)  Working from my memory, our dinners consisted of 1) red snapper bisque 2) a tuna tartare with arugula 3) scallops and grits 4) Amish chicken 5) Wagyu beef with spinach and potatoes 6) Flourless chocolate cake / apple tart, both topped with some kind of ice cream  There were interesting flavors, and we really wanted to love our meals, but unfortunately many of the courses were too salty. The bisque was too salty, as was the tuna tartare, as was the scallops. The chicken and the beef were fine, though I wonder if it had to do with our palates shifting by that point. The wagyu beef was simply a nice steak--it was not marbeled beef as I had expected wagyu to be. Tender but not buttery, and as someone who used to live in Japan and had eaten plenty of wagyu, I felt like there was some kind of mislabeling going on.  The ice cream and the cake were good; I wasn't as big a fan of the apple tart.  We had a good time, and we really enjoyed the service, the atmosphere, etc. It's just unfortunate that for the price we paid, we had difficulty enjoying the food.
My experience at Corduroy was the closest to perfect as it can be. Food, wine and service were superb. The place was quiet so you can dine and have a pleasant conversation
Pricey and completely dead on a Tuesday evening. Good service. Good food.

We came here for Christmas Eve celebrations, when the menu is seasonal and reservations are tricky. In a party of 6, our family all ordered different things on the menu, and we were pleasantly surprised by how well crafted each dish was. This is by far one of the best restaurant experiences I've had in DC, where other restaurants use tasteless GM-ed foods, Corduroy uses locally sourced food. Service was excellent, and it was not noisy at all, with the floor carpeted. Loved the experience!
Lovely restaurant! I dined here last night and we had the lovely five course chef tasting menu! Everything was delicious including the wine! Great service as well! Highly recommended!
Even if somewhat pricey, it's still an amazing value. Great food. Excellent staff. We try to get here at least yearly.

This restaurant was so fantastic,the food was divine, and the service was done with great taste, we had a large group and had to split the check several ways, our server was so kind to accommodate our request, it took a few extra minutes, we thank him for his service, I would imagine it took up some of his time we appreciate it,and we will be back to this gem of a restaurant.I would not believe any bad reviews on this restaurant,just not true, everything about corduroy the food,the exqusite wine list and the service is top notch.

Great food. Great meal service. Terrible finish.  This restaurant lost a member of our party's jacket for 20 minutes as we were waiting to leave. In single digit weather...  It took the waiter 40 minutes to split the check for our table (when we told him at the beginning of our meal service that we were going to be paying separately, so that delay could have been avoided). It turns out that the restaurant still calculates split checks by hand...AND it was done incorrectly in spite of us writing down what each person ordered and to which card it should be charged.  We also found that the restaurant overcharged several of our cards after the fact by about 10%. This was not a service charge issue. For a high end restaurant, this is unacceptable service. If I could, I would take back the tip that we did leave for the hassle that our party has had to endure post-dinner. We will not be returning here. What should have been a 2.5 hour meal for us turned into a 4 hour ordeal.

Excellent service and a truly wonderful special Christmas menu. For my three-course meal, I had a squash soup as a starter, the seared tuna with sushi rice as a main and a personal highlight were the chocolate/hazelnut bars for dessert. Everyone at the table was incredibly pleased with their choices and I can't wait to come back again when I am back in the city.

Have a special occasion to celebrate and a group of  9-10 people? Ask for the front room and pre-order your menu. They do a great job - ask for the front "room" by the window and order your bubbly to be chilled and ready before you arrive to avoid delaying the toast!
I love this restaurant. The tomatoe salad is excellent. As is the bass. The waiter and hosts are also very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend Corduroy.

Service was excellent, menu selection were fairly broad and the ambience was nice for a nice date or professional dinner. Food was pretty good but I felt that the price was a little high for where the food came out at. Definitely better food in DC for the same price range.

So many superlatives. Loved this place since it was in the original townhouse. Still incredible, wish I lived nearby to enjoy more often. Not flashy, very understated, just wonderful. A rare find despite recent lobbyist-driven expense account DC dining trends (which are silly and annoying btw)
Wonderful environment with a great taste, small size and a little bit pricy. Overall I had a great time and enjoyed the dinner. I would go back.
It was very good and loved the steak
Delicious
Food was good and our table server good.   For the price, not overly inviting.   Sat at the bar before dinner and took awhile to get noticed even while making eye contact.
Great food and service, but atmosphere is almost utterly lacking.
Exemplary service, treatment that makes you feel special

Overhyped, fairly average in food and service. The staff seemed unconcerned about our table and the next. It feels pretentious, without good reason to be. No one was relaxed or particularly comfortable looking.

Corduroy deserves 3.5 stars in my book.  I truly enjoyed my dinner here, but I believe it was moreso due to the great company that I had.  Service: B-  I arrived on time for our reservation.  The hostess was on the phone and did not bother to acknolwedge my presence.  Finally, she gets off the phone, apologizes and tells me the table was not ready.  I was asked to go to the bar to wait.  10 minutes later, I was escorted to my table.  I found the dining room upstairs to be intimate and cozy.  Our server was nice but seems a bit rusty.  He forgot to give us the cocktail menu, and didn't pay attention to the specific articulated request on how my friend wanted her martini made.  At the end of the meal, he also forgot to bring out coffee for my friend who ordered it.  Appetizer:  -soft shell crab - A I really enjoyed the soft shell crab.  It was delicious! Apparently it was in season so the crab was really fresh.  -lobster carpaccio - B- Our entire table didn't really enjoy the lobster carpaccio.  It was slimy and lacking in flavors.  We all agreed that we couldn't really taste the flavor of the lobster.  Entree:  -Prime Rib - B+ I'm really surprised by my own rating.  I'm usually a meat kind of person and would chose beef over seafood any day.  However, while the prime rib, medium rare, was cooked well, it was a bit tough.  It was enjoyable, but nothing special.  -Rare Big Eye Tuna - A- The tuna was seared perfectly.  It was pink in the middle and super fresh.  -Sea Scallops - A+ The best item of the night was the sea scallops.  It melted in my mouth and paired perfectly with the Sauvignon Blanc that we orderd.  By far, this was the table's favorite for the night.  Desserts:  -Fruit Sorbets - A I don't typically order sorbets but agreed to share some with the table.  The flavors were super refreshing.  -Chocolate Sabayon - B+ I was expecting this to be a warm lava type cake but apparently Sabayon's are more on the dry side.  My disappointment was due to my own incorrect expectations so no fault to the restaurant.  The cake was enjoyable but nothing to write home about.  Overall: I would recommend coming to corduroy if you are looking for some great food and ambiance.  The service is rusty but that's never stopped me from returning to a place.  Dinner took much longer than it should have, so if you have time constraints, remember to remind the server to speed it up a bit.
Walked in with a party of 6 and before we even got in the door a man stepped out to advise us he could not seat us. When asked about a wait time he simply stated we can not seat you and walked away.
Perfect lighting, gracious and timely service, perfectly sized portions, excellently prepared, fantastic and well priced wine list. Couldn't ask for a better dining experience.
Awesome
Service was good, food was great, but it feels a little overpriced. Corduroy is always packed though so clearly other people disagree with me.

Last night was AWESOME! The staff at Corduroy served us the 5 course tasting menu paired perfectly with wine. The attention to detail in every aspect of dinner was wonderful. So happy to live in DC where fine dining restaurants like this thrive. We cannot wait to bring more friends from around the country to Corduroy!!
Delicious and inventive cuisine in a beautifully curated decor. Bravo!

I shouldn't want to find a burger or taco joint a couple hours after eating a $100 meal. Very attentive and knowledgeable server, almost a bit over the top for me.  While the food was very good, it was overpriced and under-sized in my opinion.  This is the type of place that reinforces the stereotype that "normal" people with "normal" budgets have of upscale restaurants: little servings of stuff you've never heard of before with price tags high enough to feed a family elsewhere, and a host who almost seems like his job is purely to stroke your ego and convince you this this stuff is actually good (like a used car salesman pitching "pre-owned" as though it adds value, or a realtor who describes a cramped apartment as "cozy").  Example, a couple of my friends had the scallop tartare: I think there was the "normal" meat of one scallop on the plate (the adductor), along with an organ that normally gets thrown out in the US (the roe).  If that organ is garbage a Red Lobster for $10, I doubt it has any more value when you pay $35 to have it served to you raw.  But the foodie reviewers will never admit that.  While my dish (what there was of it) was very good, I could have done just as well myself on the grill at home.  I've just got too much midwestern common sense to get wrapped up in the hype of places like this.  But if somebody else is willing to pay the tab, by all means check it out.

Dining at Corduroys was a wonderful experience. We had the chefs special tasting menu & everything they brought exceeded our expectations. They had a bottle of Champagne already waiting & chilling by the table when we arrived. The staff was very knowledgable & attentive. The pomegranate manhattan was Devine, you won't be disappointed. I think the only thing Corduroys lacked was comfort, the seats, at least the booth we sat in was uncomfortable.

We've been wanting to eat at Corduroy for a few years & on a last minute trip to DC, we booked a  reservation. The food did not disappoint. Sashimi tuna appetizer was incredible as were the seared scallops. Maybe I'm being picky, but the server was distant & mechanical throughout the meal. It wouldn't stop me from going back, but I know that a more engaged server would have inspired me to extend my meal & most likely increase my check.

The restaurant seems to be upscale, but unfortunately the service is not. Drew was our server for the night and he lacks what you would expect from a place like this, he never came back to check if we were satisfied with our food (which we weren't), nor did anyone care to clean up our table or see if we wanted anything else. After we had to ASK for him to come to the table, he finally asked how it was (once we were already done, too late to ask). He sent the manager to check on us, but obviously there wasn't anything to be done at that point. Overall, it was a very disappointing experience and will never come back to this place. Too bad the staff doesn't really care about their patrons.
The food is wonderful, but be prepared to waitl.

This is a mixed bag and may be great for some. First, the service was excellent, very good and attentive. The space is modern but somewhat boring and not that warm of a feeling. Now for the food. I'm a vegetarian and Corduroy seems to love having meat in everything in a heavy dose. While this aspect is not bad, the vegetarian items that the chef put together were unimaginative and somewhat boring vegetable plate. The chef also offered pasta with mushrooms which every restaurant seems to offer. I would have expected something a bit more substantive. The bread putting was a little dry though the caramel ice cream that came with it was delicious. While the meats may be good, I would not recommend it if you don't want lots of exotic meats.
Yummy sea scallops, good desserts, and a very quality pomegranate Manhattan = awesome evening.  Expensive, so save it for a special occasion.

still one of the finest meals in town. tom power's hand with soups is unbeatable, and it's a menu of changing favorites with no weaknesses. if you see pork belly or scallops on the menu, don't hesitate. the bar menu is a steal.
